intro: Jacobaea erucifolia subsp. argunensis, commonly known as the Armenian tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, yellowish-green foliage and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in compact, disc-like heads. It is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
